metadata.Title: SoilTemperatureSWAT
metadata.Extended description: Strategy for the calculation of soil temperature with the SWAT method. It computes soil temperature by layers using a damping-depth approach influenced by bulk density, water content, layer thickness, surface soil temperature, and annual average air temperature. Reference: Neitsch, S.L., Arnold, J.G., Kiniry, J.R., Williams, J.R., King, K.W. Soil and Water Assessment Tool. Theoretical documentation. Version 2000. http://swatmodel.tamu.edu/media/1290/swat2000theory.pdf
metadata.Short description: Calculates soil temperature by layer using the SWAT damping-depth method with a lag coefficient, driven by surface and annual average air temperatures and soil physical properties.
